summary: This document is a collection of U.S. Marshals Service forms and records related to the arrest, booking, and initial custody of Jeffrey Epstein on July 8, 2019. It includes his personal history, medical clearance forms, arrest warrant, custody reports, and related administrative paperwork. This document is a collection of administrative forms and a court filing related to the seizure and forfeiture of Jeffrey Epstein's property at 9 East 71st Street in New York. It includes a Notice of Lis Pendens, a Notice of Pendency, a Federal Prisoner Property Receipt, and related procurement vouchers and task orders from the U.S. Marshals Service, all dated around July 2019. This document is a sealed indictment and notice of pendency (lis pendens) filed in the Southern District of New York against Jeffrey Epstein. It charges him with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors from 2002 to 2005, detailing the operation at his New York and Palm Beach residences. It also includes a notice seeking forfeiture of his New York mansion and a US Marshals Service subject report on Epstein. This document is a compilation of US Marshals Service (USMS) reports and forms detailing the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's compliance with sex offender international travel reporting laws (International Megan's Law) and his subsequent custody and death. It includes witness interviews, investigative updates, and administrative records showing the investigation was closed after his suicide.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the USMS investigation for failure to report international travel as required by International Megan's Law. The reports detail his 2008 conviction, his travel patterns, and conclude with his suicide in custody on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Issued the arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein on July 2, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary defendant charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors. The indictment details his systematic abuse of dozens of minor girls at his residences in New York and Florida from 2002 to 2005.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the Notice of Pendency for the forfeiture of Epstein's property.

persons.name: Stacy Rider
persons.context: An administrative officer with the U.S. Marshals Service who certified funds and authorized payments related to the property seizure process.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: Listed as an associate (brother) of Jeffrey Epstein in the US Marshals Service subject report.

persons.name: Woo
persons.context: Listed as the 'REPORTED BY' agent (AT: WOO) on multiple USMS Reports of Investigation. They are the originating officer for the investigative updates.

persons.name: Senior Inspector (SI)
persons.context: A USMS Senior Inspector who conducted a witness interview with an air traffic controller on July 10, 2019, and traveled to the US Virgin Islands in July 2019 to work on the case. The name is redacted.

persons.name: Supervisory Inspector (SI)
persons.context: A USMS Supervisory Inspector who, along with a Senior Inspector, met with Miami Herald reporter Julie K. Brown on June 24, 2019. The name is redacted.

persons.name: Julie K. Brown
persons.context: Met with USMS inspectors on June 24, 2019, and provided information about potential informants, including an airport worker who saw Epstein with young girls and other individuals with knowledge of Epstein's activities.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: Mentioned by Julie K. Brown as one of Epstein's disgruntled attorneys who owned a modeling company and helped recruit girls for Epstein. The USMS was advised not to contact him yet.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is prosecuting Epstein and initiating forfeiture proceedings against his property.
Epstein directed Employee-1, a New York-based employee, to communicate with victims to schedule sexual encounters at the New York residence.
Epstein arranged for Employee-2 to contact victims to schedule encounters at the Palm Beach residence, including calls made from New York.
Employee-3, an assistant, placed calls to schedule encounters for minor victims at the Palm Beach residence.
Epstein repeatedly sexually abused Minor Victim-1 at the New York residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein repeatedly sexually abused Minor Victim-2 at the Palm Beach residence, paid her, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Epstein repeatedly sexually abused Minor Victim-3 at the Palm Beach residence, paid her, asked her age, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.
Mark Epstein is listed as Jeffrey Epstein's brother in the US Marshals Service subject report.
Brunel is described by a reporter as an attorney for Epstein who owned a modeling company and helped recruit girls for him.
Brown served as a source for the USMS investigation, providing tips and contact information for potential witnesses.
The air traffic controller witnessed Epstein disembarking from his plane with young girls on multiple occasions in 2018 and reported this to the USMS.

events.title: Arrest Warrant Issued
events.description: United States Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses issues an arrest warrant for Jeffrey Epstein based on an indictment.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is arrested by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI).

events.title: Initial Custody and Booking
events.description: Epstein is processed into U.S. Marshals Service custody, photographed, and fingerprinted.

events.title: Custody Ended
events.description: Epstein's custody status with the U.S. Marshals Service ends, with a remark 'CASE -RESOLVED' and 'SUICIDE' noted on the same date.

events.title: Filing of Notice of Lis Pendens
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a Notice of Lis Pendens (Notice of Pendency) against Jeffrey Epstein's property at 9 East 71st Street, initiating forfeiture proceedings related to criminal case 19 CR 490.

events.title: Filing and Payment of Notice of Pendency
events.description: The Notice of Pendency is officially filed with the New York County Clerk's Office, and a $35.00 filing fee is paid, completing a step in the asset forfeiture process.

events.title: Beginning of Sex Trafficking Operation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein begins enticing and recruiting dozens of minor girls to engage in sex acts with him at his New York and Palm Beach residences.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1 and Scheduling Call
events.description: Epstein abuses Minor Victim-1 in New York. Employee-1, on behalf of Epstein, calls Minor Victim-1 to schedule an appointment for paid sex acts.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-3 and Scheduling Calls
events.description: Epstein abuses Minor Victim-3 in Florida. Employee-2 and Employee-3 place calls to Minor Victim-3 to schedule appointments for paid sex acts with Epstein.

events.title: Filing of Sealed Indictment and Notice of Pendency
events.description: The United States District Court for the Southern District of New York files a sealed indictment against Jeffrey Epstein and a notice of pendency against his New York property.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Conviction
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was convicted under Florida Statute 796.03 for procuring a person under the age of 18 for prostitution and sentenced to 13 months incarceration.

events.title: Epstein Reports Travel to France
events.description: Epstein signed a Notification of Duty to Report travel with the US Virgin Islands Sex Offender Registry, stating he would travel to France from March 19-29, 2019.

events.title: Epstein's Jet Travels to Vienna
events.description: Flight tracking data shows Epstein's private jet (N212JE) traveled to Vienna, Austria, a country not listed on his travel notification form.

events.title: Epstein Arrested by FBI
events.description: Epstein was arrested by the Federal Bureau of Investigation on charges of sex trafficking conspiracy (18 USC 371).

events.title: Epstein's Suicide in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.

events.title: USMS Investigation Closed
events.description: Following Epstein's death, the USMS, in agreement with the US Virgin Islands AUSA's office, closed the International Megan's Law investigation, cancelling all warrants and investigative activities.

locations: Little St. James, St. Thomas, VI 00802
9 East 71st Street, New York, New York 10021
500 Pearl Street, New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Marshals Service - SDNY)
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office - SDNY)
New York County Clerk's Office, 1 Centre Street, Room 109B, New York, NY 10007
9 East 71st Street, New York, New York 10021 (New York Residence)
6100 Red Hook Quarter, B3, St. Thomas, VI 00802
New York, NY (9 East 71st St., MCC New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on July 8, 2019, by the FBI on charges of sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors.
The arrest warrant was issued by U.S. Magistrate Judge Barbara Moses on July 2, 2019, in the Southern District of New York (Case No. 19-CR-00490).
Epstein's U.S. Marshals custody began on July 8, 2019, and ended on August 10, 2019, with the remarks 'CASE -RESOLVED' and 'SUICIDE' logged for the end date.
The documents note Epstein had 'Suicidal Tendencies' and 'Mental Concerns' listed under special cautions and medical assessments.
Epstein was held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for 33 days following his arrest.

The U.S. government initiated forfeiture proceedings against Jeffrey Epstein's New York City mansion at 9 East 71st Street in July 2019, filing a Notice of Pendency (Lis Pendens) as part of criminal case 19 CR 490.
The property is legally described as Block 1386, Lot 10 in Manhattan and was owned by the corporate entity Maple Inc.

The U.S. Marshals Service processed administrative paperwork, including a procurement voucher for a $35 filing fee paid to the New York County Clerk, and initiated a 'Pre-Seizure Package' analysis of the property.
The documents show coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (Geoffrey S. Berman) and the U.S. Marshals Service in the asset forfeiture process following Epstein's indictment.
Jeffrey Epstein is charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors from at least 2002 to 2005.
The indictment describes a systematic scheme where Epstein abused dozens of minor girls, some as young as 14, at his New York and Palm Beach homes, paying them hundreds of dollars per encounter.
Epstein used employees (referred to as Employee-1, Employee-2, Employee-3) to schedule encounters and encouraged victims to recruit other minors, creating a "vast network" of underage victims.
The U.S. government filed a notice of pendency (lis pendens) seeking forfeiture of Epstein's New York mansion at 9 East 71st Street, owned by Maple, Inc.

A US Marshals Service subject report lists Epstein's personal details, addresses, and associates, including his brother Mark Epstein, and notes he is a lifetime sex offender registrant in NY and Florida.

The US Marshals Service was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein in 2019 for potential violations of International Megan's Law due to his failure to report all international travel as a registered sex offender.

A witness interview with an air traffic controller revealed sightings of Epstein disembarking from his plane with girls who appeared to be as young as 11-12 years old between June/July and November of 2018.

Investigative reporter Julie K. Brown provided the USMS with leads, including an informant who saw girls board a helicopter from Epstein's island to his plane, and named Jean-Luc Brunel as someone who helped recruit girls for Epstein.

Flight data obtained by the USMS in August 2019 revealed Epstein's jet had traveled to many more countries than he had reported, including Austria and Monaco during a March 2019 trip he had only reported as being to France.
The entire USMS investigation was closed on August 19, 2019, after Epstein's suicide, with all pending search warrants and international evidence requests (MLATs) being cancelled.
